website_summaries.verdict: A great choice if you are looking for a picture frame to hold two prints alongside your child's photo.
pros: A great product for parents with twins
Buyers were impressed with the clay's flexibility
Holds one 5- by 7-inch photo in the middle of the frame
cons: Covering for the photo is made out of plastic rather than glass

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I went in knowing it was not going to be perfect, so I'm happy with my turnout. 3 stars for a few reasons. The rolling pin is .5 inch shorter than the width of the frame, so you'll never have a perfect outcome..it leaves a line imprint. Very dumb. Another reason is the photo gives the idea that when you go the impression, you can flip the frame around to show a raised imprint. (If that makes sense) but it doesn't. And finally it doesn't come with a glass to cover the 2 molds! It's just open.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Kneads Some Improvements
customer_reviews.text: Neat product but could use some improvements. The clay comes in a square block that you have to knead first then roll out into the square frames. Not terribly hard but extra steps I wasn't expecting. As a perfectionist it drove me crazy that I couldn't get the surface perfectly smooth and crackless. I finally gave up after re-kneading the clay 4 times. The clay is a little harder than I expected too even after adding a few drops of water so I had to work on the imprints to make them look more defined. It settled and hardened in about 48 hours. I was satisfied with the final product but wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to get the clay ready and do the hand and foot imprints. It did take a little longer for mine to dry then what they said it would. The one thing that I would change about this product is to have glass covering the finished hand and foot imprints so that it could be easily cleanable and you wouldn't get dust, Etc in it.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie P.

customer_reviews.title: Cute gift for a friend or loved one!
customer_reviews.text: This makes a great gift for someone else or for a family member. The clay is easy to use and place in the picture frame, it does take some work to get the clay fully flat (the bigger challenge is getting a 3 month old to cooperate for a hand print!). The clay washes off easily with water and dries within a few days. The picture size is a 5x7, but you will need to trim the picture a little to fit in the frame
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Clay is easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice. Getting the hand/foot prints was much easier than I expected. There is a plastic sheet where the picture goes and it was scratched up when delivered. Glass would be much better. Also, the description says it's a 5x7 picture, but a 5x7 is to big. I had to cut the picture down almost half an inch and angle the corners for it to fit. Still, the clay was easy to work with, prints were easy, and I'm happy with the end result.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product and am quite unimpressed with it. I brought one with the black frame, and there were pieces of black stuff that came off onto the clay as I was trying to use it, making it look dirty. I saw this on both side of the frame I was using and on the rolling stick. I am quite unhappy to see this disappointing results after spending so much time and effort on trying to get my baby's hands and foot to stay still! The clay also cracked after drying even though I followed the instructions very carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina :)

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this for a birthday gift for my husband. I had bought a similar one 2 years ago for our first and wanted him to have similar keepsake for our second. The claim that it fits 5x7 print is misleading as it’s definitely meant to hold a smaller image. Only marginally smaller though so as long as your print has a forgiving border you can alter (mine didn’t) then you should be fine. It’s also smaller than the first one I bought but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Expired clay by 3 years. Dried and cracking
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a family craft for my husband's first father's day. In 2020... Opened it to dry cracking clay with a use by date of 2017... Very unhappy. Hope they see this and extend a refund. Also, you can't hang this vertically, no hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole G

customer_reviews.title: Good and easy exercise but not very appealing
customer_reviews.text: I got this keepsake for my baby's first birthday. It's very easy to use and had detailed instructions. But it is certainly very hard to print baby hand and foot print. My baby used to get startled while asleep when I tried to put on his prints. But it was easy to restart the process and could get it right after couple of trials. Even after following given process, I got some tiny cranks in surface. Giving 3 stars because overall appearance of frame doesn't seem appealing after completion.
customer_reviews.author: Anuradha Sapkal

customer_reviews.title: We've made 6 of these.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little pricey for what you get but they're cute. We did these for both our girls after they were born and a set for the grandparents... so 6 total. The clay did wrinkle and slightly crack a bit as it dried. To correct that, I used a wet finger and lightly rubbed the wrinkles and cracks out. In the end we have a wonderful memory frame that we love and the grandparents cherish. Just a bit pricey for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: PuddleSplasher

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this! Prints came out so cute! Frame is heavy and sturdy. I do wish the picture was covered in glass not plastic but that is minor. Make sure you keep the clay covered as it will develop a leathery texture fairly quickly making the prints challenging. The directions do say that over and over but I did underestimate! Lol I would definitely reccomend this to anyone looking for a cute baby keepsake (and what an AWESOME baby shower gift!)!
customer_reviews.author: Shall

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use. Comes in a box, 2 separate clay packages, rolling pin included. I loved this!! I stretched the clay out as stated, then rolled to make it even across, with the first side I did both his hands, some little cracks but it still dried good. The other side I did his 2 feet... I didnt have the roller so I used my hands to even it out as best I could... it actually dried smoother that way...no cracks...
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: The clay is not easy to mold into the corners of the frame or make smooth with the wooden roller provides. I’ve used other molding products to make handprints and this is the worst one. I bought two as gift and dint bother to open the second one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniela Greenhill

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful. Not user friendly. The clay is impossible to roll out evenly. The hand print and foot print we did is barely noticeable and we pushed our poor little baby's hands and feet down hard. Not even a minute after finishing the clay started cracking and is all wrinkled. I consider this a relatively pricey product and am extremely disappointed and bummed I wasted the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Yerges

customer_reviews.title: Super cute & easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: Just did these on Sunday after our twins turned 1. The clay is pretty easy to work with & came off the frame. Didn't love the wooden roller that came with it (too short & thin) but used a different roller for final smoothing. Wasn't too bad to reset after some failed prints. Tip - put some lotion on baby's hand & foot for easier release & clean-up. They look great, though one side got a small crack in the clay. Overall happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Cute gift for grandparents
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product. The grandparents loved this as a gift. The clay was somewhat difficult to get smooth in the frame but worth the extra time. Easy enough to redo if baby doesn't cooperate with imprinting.
customer_reviews.author: MidnightShopper

customer_reviews.title: Cute idea
customer_reviews.text: This was a neat activity to do with my little one and I can preserve her hand and footprint forever. This was a little difficult though to get a baby to leave her print...but I was able to get a good enough one. Was easy to set up the clay and dried overnight with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick but could be nicer
customer_reviews.text: The clay works nicely but the middle section where the photo is supposed to go is kind of cheap. Rather than glass protecting the photo, there's a thin sheet of plastic. Also, it's supposed to fit a 4 x 6 photo but the frame is slightly larger on all sides so you'll see a little bit of black around the photo you place there. Finally, I'm hesitant to hang it up because I'm not altogether sure how the dried clay stays in place. It would be a shame if the clay fell out and shattered while the frame was hanging up.
customer_reviews.author: Kinda

customer_reviews.title: Great Frame! I actually used this twice
customer_reviews.text: Great Frame! I actually used this twice, once for my 2-year-old, and once for my 3-month-old. The clay is easy to take out and mold into the frame and it dries fast in the summer. In the colder weather, it took a day or 2 longer. To make the surface really smooth before the imprint, I used a damp washcloth and it got the wrinkles and cracks out of the clay. It hangs nicely on the wall, and the clay even when dried sticks securely in the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Aumann

customer_reviews.title: ... these and the clay part for the impression in great, works every time and was soft and manageable
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these and the clay part for the impression in great, works every time and was soft and manageable. The picture frame part is the negative of the product, it is not a 5 x 7 size but is much smaller requiring quite a bit of trimming of a photo. The frame size is not even the same among the four I have purchased, so quality control is a little bit lacking in this product. I gave it three stars because it does work just requires a little bit of adjustments for the picture.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weston

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory
customer_reviews.text: Good in theory, but really hard to get good impressions of both hands and both feet of a baby. If you are thinking to use this for a baby, will be harder than you think. Every time you mess up, you have to rewipe the clay to get it even and do over...not the easiest thing with an uncooperative baby. Try getting ink pad for babies and putting impressions on that, then use a better quality frame that is similar to this one and you will likely be happier with the result. The actual frame itself is not that great quality. Ended up throwing it out after a few failed attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Santosh Nair

customer_reviews.title: Grandma loved this gift
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it is hard to get a newborns handprint, but it is possible. If you are a perfectionist, don't get this. The clay won't be 100 percent smooth and the prints won't be perfect but overall it does look good, it makes an amazing keepsake and it is worth it
customer_reviews.author: Alei

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the 44 YEAR old down syndrome gal I care for. We gave the gift to my mom for mother's day. (My little gal calls hers grandma). Great product! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Dewar

customer_reviews.title: Adorable picture frame
customer_reviews.text: I love this frame. The clay was easy to work with. The only hard part was holding my two month old monster still enough to get clear hand and foot prints. I recommend having 1-2 assistants handy when you go to take the prints.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S

customer_reviews.title: Super great!
customer_reviews.text: Hardest part was getting my 2 month old to unfold her hand to make a print! lol otherwise this is great and I will cherish it for ever! Oh only downside is the glass in the middle for the picture. that could be better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: The clay was a bit messier than I expected and was really hard to even and smooth it out. One side cracked within a few hours. Cleaned up easy though.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to create a mold
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how easy it was to create that mold. The paste was very easy to work with, softer than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Must have for every child!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy to redo if you mess up!!!! I would recommend having someone else around to help hold the baby still while pressing prints into clay. It turned out great. The thing I like about the press molds over a ink print is you can see every little wrinkle and cold of skin. So adorable to look back and have this keepsake of my little ones. Be sure to order it while pregnant so it's already at home waiting on you when you get home from hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Clary Family

customer_reviews.title: Clean/calm child needed
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your kids hands are clean and they are in a “patient” mood/mentality. Otherwise pretty awesome kit. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: wade canfield

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out for us.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as it seems like something normal people would do, we are not a crafty family so perhaps we were just out of our area of expertise. The clay cracked and seperated and it was hard to smooth out into the frame. I know I made a god awful mess of it. Perhaps we should have watered the clay or something, I don't know anything about clay if it was concrete I could have gotten it to work. it just didn't work for us. I am not even sure we have it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: PegLeg

customer_reviews.title: OK product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something like this and this is cute it's just really hard to get hand and foot prints. The feet were pretty easy and the clay didn't crack, but when I tried the hands it was difficult and the clay ended up cracking :-/ not sure yet if I am going to put it on the wall. They do explain how to get it to not crack and I read all the instructions, but it ended up cracking anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Erica D

customer_reviews.title: cute keepsake, for OLDER babies
customer_reviews.text: If your baby is small, like mine was (4 mths), then I recommend looking for another way to preserve their prints. The product is just as described, but I felt like I had to push his little hands SO HARD to get a proper impression in this clay. It is really cute, but I would recommend waiting to use until baby is maybe 9-12 months old. Edited to add: the product packaging says the frame fits a 5 x 7 photo...it’s actually a 4 x 6.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Singhass

customer_reviews.title: Clay Cracked, waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to the negative reviews. Did everything as directed, kneaded the clay, rolled it out as even as I could (rolling pin didn't help, the clay was very sticky and the rolling pin only stuck to clay and pulled it out, didn't smooth it at all) ended up using my palm to spread and smooth clay out. After I got the foot print and hand print in the clay I put it well out of the way where no one could touch or see it and the next day the clay was cracked! Total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K.

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy customer
customer_reviews.text: The clay was not a super good quality and after following the instructions perfectly, the clay cracked on one side. Not a happy camper because this was to mark a date of significance for my son and now I have to do another one on a different day.
customer_reviews.author: Janna B

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and VERY CUTE
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to which way the picture hanger in the back is when you are making your molds. I didn't and accidentally did mine upside down. Still, easy to use and VERY CUTE. Use Modge Podge glue and give the clay a top coat after it dries. It will fill in small cracks and seal it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super cute keepsake!
customer_reviews.text: This is super cute!! I love having the hand and foot print from my baby’s first birthday and the corresponding picture. The clay was pretty easy to work with, but it was hard to keep it moist and not let it crack when drying. Also, the plastic covering for the picture had scratches and imperfections, so it makes the picture seem scratched which sucks. I’ll just have to find some replacement plastic or glass.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, however, someone gifted me a kit when my older son was born. I like it better than this one. It was very soft and smooth. This one has a a harder clay and get crises quickly. That one came with a glass cover this one doe not have a glass cover. But this one is large enough to even get my 5 year old son's handprints. He was feeling left out so I tried to get his handprint thinking that the frame may not be large enough but to my surprise it was! So I could get my baby's footprint and my older one's handprint. I'm happy 😊
customer_reviews.author: Amit Rahalkar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I did the handprint and footprint today. The clay was soft and not sticky. We were able to do the baby prints quickly and easily. The only reason I did not give this item 5 stars is because we wished we could have made the clay smoother than it was. This may be the users problem(meaning me).
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth K Gassmann

customer_reviews.title: kind of cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: really wanted to like this, but it isn't great. the plastic for the picture was scratched on arival, it is a really cheap plastic. actually, the whole set up is kind of cheap, but i guess you get what you pay for. the material is easy enough to work with, just add water to work with again if you need to do redos (their little hands are not easy to work with :) they just like their fists!)
customer_reviews.author: Red Cat

customer_reviews.title: Easy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I bought one for my parents and one for my in-laws, and made prints of our son for his second Christmas as gifts. One square on one of them cracked a little as it dried, but it's small and the grandparents loved it. And the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Carolee E. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: It looks OK - the clay was very hard and very difficult to get to the right consistency. Not very easy to get into the mold of the frame, either. Turned out OK - I think a slightly different tone of color in the clay would make the prints stand out more - even as deep as they are, the detail in the prints is not very visible unless you are looking very closely. Also would prefer the orientation of the picture to be turned 90 degrees - nowadays, you don't take many digital pictures with your camera sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great price
customer_reviews.text: Loved this and it was very easy to do and clean up was very minimal. I like how you can re-do it if the first try didn't come out good (good for a squirmy 2 month old). I deducted a star because the picture size that fits in there is very odd. I had to cut a photo down in order to fit it in. Also it does not have a stand, your only option is to hang it on a wall, which I don't wanna do for fear that the cay pieces might fall out and break.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M Bolin

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss-maybe bad clay on one?
customer_reviews.text: I bought three for gifts and followed instructions exactly the same for all three. I had one turn out amazing, one mediocre and one that is terrible. Two of them cracked even though they all dried in the same place and with a damp cloth on them. Not sure why. One cracked pretty bad and the other still looks ok. Not sure how to review as the one that worked looks really good and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Saskatchewan

customer_reviews.title: Great memento
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together as long as the baby is sleepy or in a good mood. The molds came out very nicely and I’m satisfied that it will last for awhile/forever.
customer_reviews.author: Girlmommyx2

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to imprint my baby daughter's hands and feet as a gift for my parents. It was easy to use and the prints came out beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: JPShops

customer_reviews.title: Great Present for Grandparent’s
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a Christmas present for my grandma. The package came slightly damaged, but the contents were not damaged in the slightest. The clay was very easy to work with and took the imprint of my 6-y/o son’s hands very well. It was a fun project and my grandma absolutely loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Ericka

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a glass or clear plastic to cover ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was a glass or clear plastic to cover the clay prints. Followed the instructions exactly and my clay still cracked while drying (and i live in a highly humid region)!!
customer_reviews.author: HN

customer_reviews.title: Did not dry smooth
customer_reviews.text: We followed the instructions for handling the clay to a "T" (I'm an engineer and instructions are my M.O.), but it still dried really wrinkly. Over all, it was a disappointment and I'll try a different company next time.
customer_reviews.author: Greenville, SC

customer_reviews.title: Good for memories
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Happy I did the foot and hand print of my newborn
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a great memory saver
customer_reviews.text: The clay was hard to work with but it was beautiful I'm the end
customer_reviews.author: Lisa gee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gift
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful keepsake. I bought it as a gift for a friend's first child. She loves it, so I got her another one for her second child. The clay is a little difficult to work with, but still worked beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fun but exhausting getting the kid to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, fun but exhausting getting the kid to sit still to make the print, my only compliant is the material cracks over time when it dries, but still a great keepsake.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander T.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: I love this frame!! We use it for my grand baby's monthly photos. My daughter loves the idea and to see how his hands and feet grows in a month is priceless. His daddy is away for a while and he's excited to see these frames
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: Nice keepsake
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and very forgiving if you make a mistake and need to start over. My only complaint is that the cement cracks as it dries. I followed the tips to try to keep that from happening, but there are still some small cracks.
customer_reviews.author: HouseMidwife

customer_reviews.title: Great keepsake at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. I was a little tough to get it done while the baby was asleep and not wake him up. I was nervous we woudn't get it done before it dried but we were successfull and I love it. It makes a great keepsake and one you will be so glad you took the time to do. The first year goes by in a flash. There are tiny cracks in it when it dries but they are barely noticable. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have used this 3 times and enjoy the results!
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our son and daughter when they were babies as well as our dog. Each side is big enough for 2 baby feet or hands which is great. The picture frame is covered by plastic but it looks fine. The third time we ordered it, when we opened up the clay it smelled horrible and was covered in mold, which was very disturbing, but we figure it still deserves 4 stars because they replaced it right away and we love how all our pictures/prints turned out.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.E

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 2 years ago for my daughter and bought another one last month for my son. Best way to do the clay is to add a few drops of water.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: easy enough to use. does what you would expect. result is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: clay dried too fast and cracked, but would still recommend...  Please read.
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, but the clay cracked when drying. It's really dry here in North Idaho so maybe it just dried too fast? A little water on a cloth and some gentle rubbing helped the cracks blend in a bit. Would recommend with care to make sure it dries slow. Maybe spritz the surface with water a few times during the drying process?
customer_reviews.author: mherikson

customer_reviews.title: Good for pets too!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend to make prints of her dog. She said it was very easy to use and turned out great. I'd advise washing the feet or hands before, as the clay will grab onto anything. Also, you have to press hard otherwise the mold slowing releases when drying.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Saley

customer_reviews.title: Was somewhat disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with a one inch scrape flaw in the frame. When I went to see if I could return it, it was already past it's time to return. I should of checked it right when I received it, but unfortunately, with a little one I had stuff to do and didn't get to opening it up until a week later or so. It still looks cute when we got it all finished. It's a bit tricky writing anything in the clay with the writing tool. You need to do it ASAP maybe before you put your little one's foot/hand. The clay dries much quicker than I expected!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Strachan

customer_reviews.title: Great memory maker
customer_reviews.text: Have one for each child. The clay may be a little hard to work at the beginning and the frame is nothing special, but it works and the memories last forever
customer_reviews.author: D. Pozz

customer_reviews.title: great idea but hard to work with
customer_reviews.text: the idea is awesome but the effort to get the clay in, flat, even, and dried without cracks - impossible. the more you work with it - the more wood flecks would get in. my dad loved it, but i felt embarrassed giving it as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Forte

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping memories
customer_reviews.text: The clay was easy to make tiny baby imprints in
customer_reviews.author: christine m

customer_reviews.title: Very Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: I am very upset with this product. The clay was awful to work with. I added a few (and only a couple of drops of water) to try and moisten it a bit and it did not help. I was able to flatten it the best I could but with pushing hands and feet into it began to look leathery if that makes sense... it would not just be flat and level. It also cracked once dry. Very unhappy and disappointed as this was not cheap to buy and ship (to Canada).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how nice these were when they came in. They made perfect Mother's Day and Father's Day gifts for the grandparents. They clay was VERY easy to work with and spread easily. It was also easy to reform and spread when our son was NOT being so cooperative so the prints weren't coming out how we wanted. Everyone we got these for loved them. I could even see doing these for a newborn, and then doing subsequent ones as the baby gets older (1 year, 2 years, etc).
customer_reviews.author: CShukes

customer_reviews.title: Great Keepsake
customer_reviews.text: We received this from a friend for our first child. You are required to roll out the clay which takes a little work to get it to look nice, but after that it is a breeze. We enjoyed it so much we bought this for another friend as a baby present. This is now our go to for a newborn present. I Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Lovely keepsake - helps if you have some expernence with clay
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I bought 4 of them, going to do a series of 4month/6month/8month/1 year (I wish I had this when my son was a newborn!) The clay was a little dry, but adding some water and continuing to knead it really helped. My son was also fairly cooperative, but I think the idea of waiting until he's asleep to take the prints is a fantastic idea and will probably do that for the next ones.
customer_reviews.author: H. Borgeson

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the wood is not the greatest but I guess it does the job
customer_reviews.text: This worked out just okay. We followed the directions exactly but the clay still ended up drying with cracks in it. We did this with our twins at 6 weeks of age and were able to fit 2 hands and 2 feet on each clay panel. The quality of the wood is not the greatest but I guess it does the job. Hopefully it'll hold up for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie F.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This product wasn't what I thought it would be. The clay was hard to get smooth with tools given. The cover for the photo was just a piece of plastic that was so scratched up that it was unusable. When I tried to use the writing tool to use right after doing the first imprint, it looked horrible and pulled the clay. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clay cracked while drying
customer_reviews.text: It was very difficult to roll out the clay to make it smooth. The clay cracked while it was drying and there is a huge crack that stretches from one side of the frame to the other.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: very easy to mix up and use
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well, very easy to mix up and use. We used 2 toddler (3 yo) handprints instead of the hand and foot print shown.
customer_reviews.author: SFJ

customer_reviews.title: No baking, but still a nice gift.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my in-laws with my 6 week old daughter's hand/foot print. They loved it! The only drawback was the drying period is a day, wish it could have baked and been ready immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Elaina_Hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased and i love it
customer_reviews.author: Mariela

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good piece, solid, well made. I used it for our puppies paw prints. Was easy to follow directions to get the right result. Wish the pups would have been as easy! The clay doesn’t set too fast.
customer_reviews.author: Karen  Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great keepsake
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this for both of my children. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Katlin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome baby shower gift!
customer_reviews.text: Such a beautiful keepsake and very easy to make the hand and foot impressions.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Good size for babies and toddlers hands/feet
customer_reviews.text: Pretty Happy with this mold/frame so far. Did one foot on each side, my toddler and newborn, for fathers day 2014. It's great because the clay panels are big enough for a toddler foot. I hope it will hold up over time. The clay was easy to work with and clean up was simple but it was a little hard to push in my baby's foot. The clay could be a little softer.
customer_reviews.author: nycmama

customer_reviews.title: ... cute gift that we are giving to my daughters great grandparents for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute gift that we are giving to my daughters great grandparents for Christmas. The quality is nice, and it's very easy to make since there is no mixing or stirring involved. Simply knead the clay and print!
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very poor product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed! Both sections of the clay cracked once it dried! Intended for a precious keepsake, and it looks terrible!! Do not waste your time with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: the overall look is good! It's a nice way to preserve the memory ...
customer_reviews.text: One part of the wooden frame was chipped and painted over, the plastic cover for the picture was scratched, and the clay was much harder to work with than I imagined. However, the overall look is good! It's a nice way to preserve the memory of how tiny our baby was.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much, I ordered more
customer_reviews.text: The handprint and footprint came out so nice, that I have ordered two more to make one for each set of grandparents. Just a little tip - if the surface of the clay starts to crack while you are smoothing it into the frame, dab your finger in water and smooth it out. It really helps it look nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Emily McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Great gift! Works great with dog paws too!
customer_reviews.text: Its much easier to do than I first thought. I did it for my wife with paw prints from our dogs (we dont have kids...at least the human kind) and it was super easy, given that your dog/kid stays still for a couple of seconds. It comes with everything you'll need and the instructions are very straight forward and easy to follow. It makes a great gift, and can't beat the originality for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Santos

customer_reviews.title: loved it add food coloring to give color and use wet fingers to gently smooth out all over to decrease cracks
customer_reviews.text: I did this for my 4 year old daughter. I was lucky to still be able to take impression of her foot since it did say ages 0-3. she wears size 9 in shoes. And since she is a girly girl i bought the white frame so i can paint it pink. and on her impression material i added a few drops of red food coloring to make it a pink clay and few drops of water to make it manageable. she loved how it was pink. After the impressions it had already showed some cracking so i just kept my fingers wet while gently smoothing out the cracks. I'm doing the boys tomorrow and ill use blue food coloring
customer_reviews.author: mr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect project to document my babies 1 year mark. I bought this for both my kids, and I love it! Easy to use and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey R. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time with great instructions. Very easy to assemble and for the kids to do. Husband was overjoyed when he saw this for his b-day. Have two daughters and put one hand on each side with their picture in the middle. Now I want one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Goodlett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I made one with my Son for his grandmother. She loved it. It was exciting to watch it harden.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A

customer_reviews.title: Product is perfect, but editing needed.
customer_reviews.text: As far as performance for the price, this was a splendid product! It was easy to use and is beautiful. I only left 4 stars because there were obvious errors in grammar and spelling on the packaging that cheapened the product's professionalism.
customer_reviews.author: TaeRynnIan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keepsake
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Sons first birthday..It was easy to use. loved it!!
customer_reviews.author: Wils

customer_reviews.title: Good for Memories
customer_reviews.text: I had originally used one of those mold casting kits with powdered mixes and that was such a mess. Got this and it was a fairly easy and fast way to get the clay print done. Frame is decent. Would probably just get air dry clay in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lovebane

customer_reviews.title: The fit and finish of the product was fine, but I got a bad unit.  Great customer service, though.  Sent a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: One of the two packets of clay had "gone bad". It had turned black from mold (?) and REEKED with a very powerful sulfur smell. I had to immediately throw it out and then air out my kitchen. The fit and finish of the product was fine, but getting a bad unit, just three days before Mother's Day, ruins my gift idea. Back to the drawing board, I guess. UPDATE: the seller's customer service was very responsive and they have shipped me a replacement. If it makes it here before Mother's Day, I'll be all set.
customer_reviews.author: LHI

customer_reviews.title: ... material used for the handprint did not roll out nicely. There are wrinkles and cracks in it
customer_reviews.text: The dry material used for the handprint did not roll out nicely. There are wrinkles and cracks in it. We set a wet towel over it as suggested to prevent cracks, but the "clay" got the imprint of the paper towel in it. I will keep it forever but not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Nic O

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!!
customer_reviews.text: This frame is well made and is so perfect to capture your little one's hand and footprint. Make sure to soften the clay with your hands for about 5 minutes, I forgot to do it and realized something was wrong when it was tough to get my daughter's prints. I pulled out the directions and viola! Priced right!
customer_reviews.author: Nyctomato77

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: You can’t fix the clay if the baby squeezes it and when you put their hand/foot in the rest of the clay ripples and is hard to get out. Almost looks trashy
customer_reviews.author: MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to do and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to do and long lasting. Also used this for our oldest son 5 years ago and it's still just as beautiful as when we did it. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justlucky18

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Really great product. Easy to use and turned out good. Small crack formed in one of the prints but that's to be expected. Also a small crack in the plastic picture cover.
customer_reviews.author: BigDinMO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Made a great gift to my husband for fathers day.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap awsome present for wife.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loved it what else is there to say mothers day present for men not sure. I brought some water paint and art crafts diamonds and added wife loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin shoper

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make a keepsake!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use modable clay is easy to smooth into frame and air dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: We just did my granddaughters foot. She wasn't cooperating ...
customer_reviews.text: We just did my granddaughters foot. She wasn't cooperating with the hand yet. I does have a faster dry time than you might think, but plenty of time for a couple of tries. just don't wonder off to do something else. It's very cute.
customer_reviews.author: darby21

product_meta.title: Proud Baby Clay Hand & Footprint Keepsake Photo Wall Mount Frame Kit - Black
product_meta.description: This kit includes soft, pliable air-drying clay. The non-toxic clay is safe and easy to use to capture those precious little hands and feet. After you make the impressions, the clay dries into a stone-like material in a couple of days. Features: No mixing of materials and no baking. Just knead, flatten and create the impression! Kit includes: Two bags of air-drying clay, Black smooth finish wood photo wall mount frame that holds one 5" x 7" picture, Writing tool, Wooden rolling pin & Easy-to-follow instructions. Frame dimensions are 16 " long x 8 " high; acrylic cover over center photo opening only. The clay display areas are 4.6 x 6.5 inches. [[Clay Tips: To ensure a smooth dried finish, be sure the clay is rolled out evenly (not thinner on the edges, etc) and is as smooth on the surface as possible before making the print. Then, cover the clay with a slightly damp light-weight cloth for 24 hours, or until the clay surface becomes leathery hard. Also, the clay is held into the frame by being pressed into the edges of the wooden openings.]]
feature_bullets: Includes soft, pliable, air-drying clay; No Mixing; No Baking
The clay is non-toxic, safe, easy to use & dries to a stone-like material.
Recommended Ages: 0-3yrs (and older if only displaying hand impressions).
Holds one 5x7 inch photo & two 4.5 x 6.5 inch clay impressions.
Available in Desktop: Black, Mahogany, Natural; or Wall Mount: White, Black

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars667 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
